intro: Secamone betamponensis, commonly known as the Madagascar secamone, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forest areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
